title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2202.2 - Eligibility criteria and award limitations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2202.2 - Eligibility criteria and award limitations

State Regulations
(a) Income. (1)

For the purposes of this Part, income
means the sum of the incomes of persons whose incomes are required to be
reported, pursuant to section
663
of the

Education Law, after any adjustments pursuant to section
2202.3
of this Part. (2)

Income will affect the calculation of
award amounts as set forth in this Part. (3)

Applicants with incomes exceeding the
maximums set forth in this Part are ineligible for awards. (b) Tuition. To be eligible to receive an
award, an applicant's tuition must be at least $200 for the academic
year. (c) Awards. Awards may not
exceed the maximums nor fall below the minimums set forth in this

Part. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
2202.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
